lib Package¶

norma_loader Module¶

Module for importing .orm files produced by the NORMA modeling tool

class lib.norma_loader.norma_loader(filename=None)[source]¶

Loads a .orm file produced by the NORMA modeling tool into an orm_model.model class.

find(element, tag)[source]¶
load(filename)[source]¶

Loads the .orm file named filename into self.model (of class orm_model.model)

load_constraint(element)[source]¶
load_object_type(element)[source]¶

Loads an object type rooted at node element of the xml.etree.ElementTree created by parse_norma_file() into a new object_type in the object_type list self.model.object_types.

load_predicate(element)[source]¶
localTag(element)[source]¶
parse_norma_file(filename)[source]¶

Parse a NORMA File (filename) and return the ORMModel node as an xml.etree.Element

orm_model Module¶

This module is part of the ormpy package. It provides a model class to store an ORM model consisting of a set of domains, a set of predicates, and a set of constraints. It also provides an instance class to store instances of ORM models.

class lib.orm_model.constraint(name='', roles=[])[source]¶

Bases: object

A constraint restricts the valid population of an object or fact type. This class is an abstract class to be inherited by more specific constraint classes such as uniqueness and mandatory.

display()[source]¶
predicates()[source]¶
class lib.orm_model.domain(name='', id='', enum=[], min=-inf, max=inf)[source]¶

A domain identifies a set of elements of a particular data type. A domain may either be an enumerated list of legal values, or a range of legal numeric values.

display()[source]¶

Displays the name of the domain.

newval(domain_pop)[source]¶

Returns a legal value not in a population of this domain.

randval()[source]¶

Returns a random value from the domain.

class lib.orm_model.exclusion(name='', roles=[], roles2=[])[source]¶

Bases: lib.orm_model.setconstraint

An exclusion constraint requires that the population of two sets of roles is disjoint.

check(instance)[source]¶

Return the proportion of tuples covered by the constraint that satisfy the constraint.

repair(instance)[source]¶

Remove tuples that violate the constraint.

class lib.orm_model.instance(model)[source]¶

Bases: object

The instance class stores a population of a model. It consists of a reference to the model, a population of object types, and a population of fact types.

add_fact(predicate, fact)[source]¶
display()[source]¶
domain_pop(name)[source]¶
random_pop(predicate, max_size)[source]¶
rebuild_objects()[source]¶
class lib.orm_model.mandatory(name='', roles=[])[source]¶

Bases: lib.orm_model.constraint

A mandatory constraint requires that all elements in a domain play a role at least once.

check(instance)[source]¶

Checks whether the mandatory constraint is satisfied on the covered role. Returns the number of unique elements playing the role divided by the number of elements in the domain of the role.

repair(instance)[source]¶

Repairs a violated mandatory constraint by adding tuples to the affected predicate until the mandatory constraint is satisfied.

class lib.orm_model.model[source]¶

Bases: object

The model class is the ORMPY internal representation of an ORM model. It consists of a dictionary of domains (object types), a dictionary of predicates (fact types), and a list of constraints.

add_cons(constraint)[source]¶
add_dom(domain)[source]¶
add_pred(predicate)[source]¶
display()[source]¶
class lib.orm_model.predicate(name='', id='', roles=[])[source]¶

Bases: list

A predicate is a fact type in an ORM model. Implemented as a named list of roles.

display()[source]¶

Display the predicate

class lib.orm_model.role(predicate, position, roledef)[source]¶

A role is the smallest unit of a predicate. Each role in a predicate is played by objects of a single domain.

newval(model_inst)[source]¶

Get a legal value not already playing role in a model instance. First, select an unused element from the domain population. Otherwise, select a legal value from domain that is not in the population. If neither is possible, return a random value already playing that role.

pop(model_inst)[source]¶

Return population of objects playing role in model instance.

todict()[source]¶

Format the role as a dictionary for display.

class lib.orm_model.setconstraint(name='', roles=[], roles2=[])[source]¶

Bases: lib.orm_model.constraint

Class setconstraint is an abstract class intend to be inherited by specific set-based constraint implementations (e.g. subset)

display()[source]¶
predicates()[source]¶
class lib.orm_model.subset(name='', roles=[], roles2=[])[source]¶

Bases: lib.orm_model.setconstraint

A subset constraint requires that the population of one set of roles is a subset of the population of another set of roles.

check(instance)[source]¶

Return the proportion of tuples covered by the constrain that satisfy the constraint.

repair(instance)[source]¶

Delete tuples that violate the constraint.

class lib.orm_model.unique(name='', roles=[])[source]¶

Bases: lib.orm_model.constraint

A uniqueness constraint requires that all tuples in the covered roles are unique.

check(instance)[source]¶

Check whether the uniqueness constraint is satisifed on a given instance. Returns a value from 0 to 1 indicating the number of unique tuples in the covered roles divided by the total number of tuples in the covered roles.

repair(instance)[source]¶
